Perjalanan Kasus Hilangnya Dokumen TPF Munir
06 Nov 2019, 00:58 by Dewi Nurita, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Istri almarhum aktivis Hak Asasi Manusia (HAM) Munir Said Thalib, Suciwati, melaporkan Kementerian Sekretariat Negara terkait hilangnya dokumen Laporan Tim Pencari Fakta (TPF) kasus tewasnya Munir pada 2004, kepada Ombudsman RI. Dalam kasus ini, Suciwati melaporkan Kemensetneg atas tuduhan melakukan tindakan maladminstrasi.
"Seperti saya sudah bilang, kasus Munir ini sebenarnya mudah, tapi kemudian dibuat berbelit-belit oleh pemerintah yang tak mau mengungkapnya, menuntaskannya. Sehingga ini menjadi hal yang teknis," kata Suciwati saat ditemui seusai melaporkan kasus ini di Gedung Ombudsman RI, Jakarta Selatan.
Lalu seperti apa perjalanan kasus hilangnya dokumen TPF Munir ini?
Pada 23 November 2004, Presiden Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono (SBY) mengeluarkan Perpres nomor 111 Tahun 2004 tentang “Tim Pencari Fakta Kasus Meninggalnya Munir”. TPF kemudian dibentuk dan telah menyelesaikan laporan investigasi mereka. Dokumen hasil investigasi diserahkan secara langsung kepada Presiden Soesilo Bambang Yudhoyono pada 24 Juni 2005 di Istana Negara. Dokumen itu tak pernah dibuka ke publik, tiba-tiba, dokumen hasil penyelidikan TPF itu hilang.
Hilangnya laporan itu baru diketahui pada pertengahan Februari 2016. Ketika itu, KontraS mendatangi kantor Sekretariat Negara meminta penjelasan dan mendesak segera dilakukan pengumuman hasil laporan TPF. KontraS kemudian menggugat Kemensetneg. Oktober 2016, KontraS memenangkan gugatan terhadap Kemensetneg. Majelis hakim memerintahkan lembaga negara itu segera mengumumkan dokumen TPF. Namun,Kemensetneg mengaku tak memiliki dokumen tersebut.
Rezim berganti, Koalisi masyarakat sipil penggiat hak asasi manusia mendesak pemerintahan Joko Widodo atau Jokowi segera menemukan dokumen resmi laporan TPF Munir dan mengungkapkannya kepada publik serta menindaklanjuti semua hasil laporan tersebut. Kini, sudah periode kedua pemerintahan Jokowi, istana juga tak kunjung mengungkap kasus Munir.
Ombudsman RI berjanji mengusut hilangnya dokumen TPF Munir dalam kurun waktu empat bulan. "Secara keseluruhan memakan waktu 121 hari. Ini waktunya yang sampai ke rekomendasi," ujar anggota Ombudsman, Ninik Rahayu, pada Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Ninik mengatakan Suciwati sudah melengkapi persyaratan formil dan materiil dalam laporan. Suciwati melapor dugaan tindakan maladminstrasi, khususnya yang dilakukan oleh Kementerian Sekretariat Negara, yang menyebabkan dokumen tersebut hilang.
Ombudsman kemudian akan menggelar rapat pleno, untuk menentukan apakah mereka akan membentuk tim khusus atau tim gabungan untuk menangani kasus ini. Setelah itu, tim baru bergerak untuk menindaklanjuti, baik dalam bentuk klarifikasi maupun investigasi, terkait pihak yang terlibat di dalamnya
"Ini kasus sudah sangat lama ya hampir 14 tahun. Mungkin tidak lagi cara surat menyurat, tapi kita akan bertemu dan berbicara soal kasus ini supaya bisa berjalan lebih cepat," kata Ninik.
DEWI NURITA I EGY ADYATAMA
text:
The Trip of the Munir TPF Document Lost Case
Nov 6 2019, 00:58 by Dewi Nurita, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The wife of the late Human Rights activist Munir Said Thalib, Suciwati, reported the Ministry of State Secretariat related to the loss of documents from the Fact Finding Team (TPF) report on Munir's death in 2004, to the Indonesian Ombudsman. In this case, Suciwati reported the Ministry of State Secretariat for allegedly committed maladminstration.
"As I said, the Munir case is actually easy, but then it is made complicated by the government who does not want to reveal it, completing it. So that this becomes technical," Suciwati said when met after reporting the case at the RI Ombudsman Building, South Jakarta .
Then, what was the journey of the Munir TPF document missing case?
On November 23, 2004, President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono (SBY) issued Presidential Regulation number 111 of 2004 concerning "Fact Finding Team for Munir's Death". The TPF was then formed and completed their investigative report. Investigation documents were submitted directly to President Soesilo Bambang Yudhoyono on June 24, 2005 at the State Palace. The document was never opened to the public, suddenly, the documents resulting from the TPF investigation were lost.
The disappearance of the report was only discovered in mid-February 2016. At that time, KontraS went to the office of the State Secretariat asking for an explanation and urged immediate announcement of the results of the TPF report. KontraS then sued the Ministry of State Secretariat. In October 2016, KontraS won a lawsuit against the Ministry of State Affairs. The panel of judges ordered the state institution to immediately announce the TPF document. However, Kemensetneg claimed not to have these documents.
The regime changed, the civil society Coalition of human rights activists urged the government of Joko Widodo or Jokowi to immediately find the official documents of the Munir TPF report and disclose it to the public and follow up on all the results of the report. Now, in the second period of Jokowi's government, the palace has never revealed the Munir case.
The Indonesian Ombudsman promised to investigate the disappearance of Munir's TPF documents within four months. "Overall it takes 121 days. This is the time that comes to recommendations," Ombudsman member Ninik Rahayu said on Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Ninik said Suciwati had completed the formal and material requirements in the report. Suciwati reported the allegations of maladminstration, especially those carried out by the Ministry of State Secretariat, which caused the documents to be lost.
The Ombudsman will then hold a plenary meeting, to determine whether they will form a special team or a joint team to handle this case. After that, the new team moves to follow up, both in the form of clarification and investigation, regarding the parties involved in it
"This case is very long ago, almost 14 years. Maybe it's no longer the way correspondence, but we will meet and talk about this case so that it can run faster," said Ninik.
DEWI NURITA I EGY ADYATAMA
